Title: Bond
Description: A debt-based financial instrument issued by a national government, sub-national government, project company or corporate entity. A bond typically obliges the issuer to make interest payments (coupons) over a specified period and to repay the principle (amount borrowed) at the maturity date.

Title: Loan
Description: A debt-based financial instrument provided by a lender such as a commercial bank, a multi-lateral financial institution, or development agency. A loan typically obliges the borrower to make principle and interest payments over a specified period.

Title: Hybrid
Description: A debt-based instrument with equity-like participation. Also called mezzanine finance.

Title: Listed shares
Description: An equity instrument representing ownership rights in a publicly traded company. Also called stocks.

Title: Unlisted shares
Description: An equity instrument representing ownership rights in a private company.

Title: Grant
Description: Money provided without expectation of repayment.

Title: Guarantee
Description: A promise by one party to assume the debt of another if the other defaults.
